column1: AAOx3;Awake, Alert, and Oriented, times 3 (i.e., to person, place, and time)
AED;Automated External Defibrillator or Antiepileptic Drug(s)
APGAR;appearance, pulse, grimace, activity, respiration (used to assess newborns)
DLCO;[Diffusing capacity of the lung for carbon monoxide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DLCO)
DSM;[Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diagnostic_and_Statistical_Manual_of_Mental_Disorders)
H&E;[Hematoxylin and eosin, a standard tissue stain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H%26E_stain)
HELLP;[Hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, low platelets syndrome (in pregnancy)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HELLP_syndrome)
LEEP;[Loop electrical excision procedure (treatment for cervical dysplasia)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loop_electrical_excision_procedure)
MCV;[Mean corpuscular volume (average red blood cell size)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mean_corpuscular_volume)
M&M;Morbidity and mortality (often a case-conference discussion)
MSM;Men who have sex with men
REM;[Rapid eye movement (type of sleep with dreams)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapid_eye_movement_sleep)
NYHA;[New York Heart Association (often heart failure classification)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Heart_Association_Functional_Classification)
PERRL;Pupils equal, round, reactive to light
PERLA;Pupils equal and reactive to light and accommodation
PERRLA;Pupils equal, round, reactive to light and accommodation
SLL;[Small lymphocytic lymphoma (B-cell lymphoma in the lymph nodes)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B-cell_chronic_lymphocytic_leukemia)
ABSSSI;[Acute bacterial skin and skin structure infection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skin_and_skin_structure_infection)
TDaP;Tetanus, diphtheria, and acellular pertussis combined vaccine
TDAP;Tetanus, diphtheria, and acellular pertussis combined vaccine
ICD-10;[International Statistical Classification of Diseases v. 10](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ICD-10)
ICD10;[International Statistical Classification of Diseases v. 10](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ICD-10)
TID;Three times a day (Latin: ter in die)
BID;Two times a day (Latin: bis in die)
QID;Four times a day (Latin: quater in die)
